tournament.name: Common Island  A Tournament by Pauper to the People

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide board of low-cost, efficient creature cards to overwhelm the opponent with consistent and aggressive pressure. Cards like Thraben Inspector, Squadron Hawk, and Kor Skyfisher help generate card advantage and maintain a steady stream of threats, while cards like Battle Screech and Guardians' Pledge provide a way to go wide and pump up the team for a big push. Additionally, Prismatic Strands and Journey to Nowhere offer ways to control the board and protect the creatures while pushing through damage.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays, while also benefitting from the affinity mechanic to reduce costs. With a mix of removal, card draw, and burn spells, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The key strategy is to flood the board with cheap artifacts and use cards like Thoughtcast to maintain card advantage, all while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Myr Enforcer and Krark-Clan Shaman. By combining affinity and aggro strategies, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts to quickly and efficiently overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By maximizing the use of artifact creatures and spells, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast help maintain card advantage, while cards like Galvanic Blast provide direct damage to the opponent. The manabase includes artifact lands to enable the Affinity mechanic and make efficient use of mana resources. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive strategies and utilizing artifacts to gain an advantage in the Pauper format.

This mono-blue aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost faerie creatures to apply early pressure on the opponent. By efficiently countering spells with Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite, and bouncing creatures back to the opponent's hand with cards like Brinebarrow Intruder and Snap, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady tempo advantage. The inclusion of card draw spells like Of One Mind helps to ensure the deck maintains a constant stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through an array of spells and abilities while utilizing the Gate cards to ramp up mana production. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through efficient draw spells. The inclusion of Squadron Hawk provides additional card filtering and pressure on the board. The deck's synergy lies in its ability to control the game tempo and outvalue opponents through a mix of removal, card draw, and creature threats.

The main focus of this Jund Aggro deck is to utilize sacrifice effects and card draw to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle. By sacrificing creatures and artifacts, the deck aims to trigger powerful effects such as Cast Down and Fanatical Offering, allowing for quick removal and damage output. The inclusion of cards like Refurbished Familiar and Writhing Chrysalis provide additional value and flexibility in combat. Additionally, the deck includes some graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and Bojuka Bog to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent color access for all spells.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, low-cost creatures and efficiently disrupt their game plan with counterspells and tempo plays. By utilizing evasive creatures like Faeries and Ninjas, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while maintaining card advantage through drawing spells. With a low mana curve and a mix of aggressive and disruptive elements, this deck can put pressure on the opponent from the start and control the pace of the game.

The main focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins Pauper 1 vs 1 deck is to swarm the board with cheap creatures and push damage quickly. Cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker provide early aggression, while cards like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt help to deal direct damage. Clockwork Percussionist and Voldaren Epicure offer additional ways to pressure opponents. The deck also includes some card draw and burn spells to maintain momentum. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategies with various counterspells and removal spells while also generating card advantage with cards like Deep Analysis and Brainstorm. The deck also utilizes evasive creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Spellstutter Sprite to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Thorn of the Black Rose and Lórien Revealed helps maintain card advantage and board presence. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantages.

The main focus of this Pauper Elves deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and generate a large amount of mana through cards like Priest of Titania. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature buffs and card draw. With a mix of mana acceleration, card advantage, and powerful creature abilities, the deck can quickly snowball out of control and secure victory through sheer numbers and overwhelming force.

The main strategy of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Wild Growth and Utopia Sprawl, then play powerful creatures like Sagu Wildling, Nyxborn Hydra, and Avenging Hunter to create a fast and aggressive board presence. Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble are used to clear opposing creatures or deal direct damage to the opponent. The combination of efficient mana acceleration and strong creatures allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats while maintaining pressure on the opponent's life total.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the board with aggressive creatures and disrupt the opponent's mana base with land destruction spells. The key strategy is to ramp up mana with cards like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to play powerful threats like Annoyed Altisaur and Avenging Hunter early in the game. Writhing Chrysalis and Nyxborn Hydra provide additional threats, while Malevolent Rumble and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss disrupt the opponent's plans. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing High Tide to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for explosive combo plays. It includes a mix of card draw, digging spells, and untap effects to help assemble the combo pieces quickly. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to generate mana, draw cards, and eventually win the game through a powerful combo sequence. Additionally, the deck runs counter magic and disruption to protect the combo pieces and interact with the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of creature attacks and direct burn spells. Guttersnipe and Sneaky Snacker provide additional damage triggers, while Voldaren Epicure and Masked Meower serve as early game threats. Fiery Temper and Lightning Bolt deal direct damage to creatures or players, while Fireblast can be a finishing blow. Lava Dart is versatile for creature removal or reach damage. Faithless Looting helps with card selection, while Highway Robbery and Grab the Prize provide additional resources for continued aggression. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This Red Deck Wins deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes low-cost, efficient creatures like Clockwork Percussionist and Voldaren Epicure to deal damage early on, while also including a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Galvanic Blast, and Chain Lightning to finish off the opponent. With a fast mana base and a focus on dealing damage swiftly, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

This deck is focused on playing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent's life total. Cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker allow for explosive starts, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast can finish off opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and direct damage spells, using Rally at the Hornburg and Wrenn's Resolve to maintain board presence and protect key creatures. With a low mana curve and efficient spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive plays.
